intro: Meta-aletris, commonly known as the mountain aletris, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the mountainous regions of southern Europe. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided, feathery leaves. The plant produces small, white or pale yellow flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the family. Meta-aletris thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in shaded forest understories. Its botanical features make it a valuable component of alpine and woodland ecosystems.
